intro: Onosma setosa var. dichroantha, commonly known as the two-colored horseweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, blue or purple flowers in terminal clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically linear to lanceolate, and the plant is often found in dry, rocky soils. It is a perennial herb that thrives in sunny, well-drained environments.
